business.headline: How to execute a will properly, so your family avoids delays and disputesThe truth is, writing a will is only half the job. The real work begins afterwards. One missing document, one unclear clause or one forgotten instruction is enough to turn a simple inheritance into months of delay and dispute.

Expert explains why your 12% equity returns aren't realMost people believe a 12% equity return is strong growth, but according to an expert, the actual gain after inflation and taxes is much smaller. Here's why your money may not be growing as much as you think.
Fresh ED summons to Anil Ambani in fraud case after he skips second dateIn a continued push to seek clarity in the ongoing investigation, the ED has served another notice to Anil Ambani.
Sensex, Nifty bounce back after volatile day as markets cheer Bihar winThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 84.11 points to close at 84,562.78, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.90 points to end at 25,910.05.

Why safety worries are growing for India's top executivesThe report shows that 71% of corporate security chiefs in India believe the risk of violence against chief executives has increased in the last two years, marking the highest level recorded globally.

Using BNPL regularly? Your salary may be hiding an invisible debt trapHaving easy access to credit at the tap of your finger via BNPL feels convenient, but could those small pay-later purchases be quietly building into a debt trap that only shows up on payday?

From SSY to FDs: 3 smart investment schemes every parent should knowPlanning for a child's future requires wise financial choices. From government-backed savings to bank deposits, these three investments offer stability and dependable returns for parents.

Verizon to slash 15% of workforce. What's driving the massive cuts?The telecom giant has been under pressure as rivals AT&T and T-Mobile continue to offer cheaper plans and aggressive promotions, especially during the launch of new iPhone models.

Bars, coins or digital: How Indians are buying gold differently after prices crossed Rs 1 lakhFor the first time, gold breached the psychological barrier of Rs 1 lakh, a milestone that once seemed out of reach. Until that point, conversations around gold were filled with speculation: "Will gold really touch one lakh?" But once that threshold was crossed, the sentiment changed entirely.

Gold, silver dip slightly today. Is the recent rally losing steam?At the time of writing, at 12.00 pm, gold on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) was slightly down by 0.30%, trading at Rs 1,26,366 per 10 grams. Silver followed a similar trend, falling 0.69% to Rs 1,61,350 per kg.

Pine Labs shares extend rally after strong IPO debut. Details hereThe stock listed at Rs 242 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, which was a 9.5 percent premium to its issue price. It later surged to Rs 283.70, a gain of 28.5 percent from the issue level. Around 12.33 pm, the shares were trading at Rs 257.35, valuing the company at Rs 29,556.63 crore.

Investor who foresaw 2008 US home crisis closes hedge fund. Here's whyThe investor has spent the past year warning about what he sees as bubbles in the market. He has sharply criticised big technology stocks and the boom in artificial intelligence (AI).

Infosys share buyback record date today: What investors should knowInfosys is conducting the buyback through the tender offer route, where it will purchase shares at Rs 1,800 per share. This is more than 18% above the recent market price of around Rs 1,515.

Do taxpayers always get interest on delayed income tax refunds? Find outIf your income tax refund is taking longer than expected, you may wonder whether the tax department must pay you interest for the delay. The law does provide for interest, but not in every situation.

Capillary Technologies IPO Day 1: Check latest GMP and subscription statusCapillary operates in the AI-led SaaS and customer loyalty solutions space, serving more than 410 brands across 47 countries. The company turned profitable in FY25 after two years of losses, reporting Rs 14.15 crore in profit. Revenue increased to Rs 598 crore in FY25.

Pine Labs shares list at 10% premium: Should you hold or book profit now?Pine Labs' better-than-expected debut and strong institutional support boosted early sentiment, but analysts say elevated valuations and intense fintech competition mean investors should balance listing-day gains with disciplined, long-term positioning.

Can a daughter's name be removed from pension records? Government explainsSeveral departments had asked whether a daughter's name should be removed from the family list after an employee retires. To settle the confusion, the DoP&PW issued an Office Memorandum clearly stating that her name must stay in the records.

Adani Group to invest over Rs 1 lakh crore in Andhra Pradesh: ReportSpeaking at a state event on Friday, Karan Adani said the investments are aimed at expanding the conglomerate's infrastructure footprint in the southern state and strengthening its long-term presence in high-growth sectors.

Sagility share price jumps over 6% today. What's driving the rally?Sagility's shares jumped after a large block deal hit the tape, with buyers overpowering supply. The stock's sharp rise suggests traders are betting the stake sale won't derail its near-term momentum.
Pine Labs share price: Stock lists at 10% premium over IPO pricePine Labs shares opened at Rs 242 on the BSE and NSE. The listing performance was slightly better than grey market expectations.

entertainment.headline: Exclusive: Lee Pace on Edgar Wright and the duality of The Running Man Lee Pace praised director Edgar Wright for crafting the "unbothered" and masked McCone, a hunter in the dystopian film The Running Man. Pace highlighted the film's dual narrative, where his character is the network's protagonist despite doing "grotesque" violence.

Hawar you? I am hava hawaie: Witty Salman Khan brings back Sridevi memories During the Da-Banng Tour in Doha, Salman Khan paid tribute to Sridevi's iconic song, 'Hawa Hawai,' from the film 'Mr India' (1987). The actor shared an image of himself being lifted high in the air by background dancers during the performance.

Rajamouli's Varanasi event: Filmmaker slams unauthorised drone leak incident SS Rajamouli expressed extreme frustration over the Varanasi teaser leak, which he blamed on a drone capturing test footage. The teaser revealed Mahesh Babu's character as 'Rudhra' fiercely yielding a trident.

Rajamouli's film titled Varanasi: Mahesh Babu plays Rudhra, yields trident Director SS Rajamouli unveiled the first glimpse of his film 'Varanasi' at the 'GlobeTrotter' event in Ramoji City, Hyderabad. Mahesh Babu's fierce, trident-yielding appearance was revealed in the first teaser from the movie.

Bigger, bolder, more audacious: Prithviraj Sukumaran on Rajamouli's Varanasi vision Actor Prithviraj Sukumaran shared insights on his career and collaboration with director SS Rajamouli at the 'GlobeTrotter' event at Ramoji Rao Film City, Hyderabad, highlighting the significance of the project and the collective pride of the Telugu film community.

Rajamouli-Mahesh Babu's Varanasi: MM Keeravani reveals release window. Read here MM Keeravani's speech at the event included a key update on 'Varanasi'. The ace music composer revealed the highly anticipated film's release window.

Mahesh Babu-Rajamouli's Varanasi: Time Trotter text ignites wild fan theories The 'GlobeTrotter' frenzy peaked even before the teaser launch, with a leaked glimpse featuring the phrase "Time Trotter" sending fans into speculation over a possible time-travel storyline in SS Rajamouli and Mahesh Babu's upcoming epic.

Amitabh Bachchan remembers late family-friend Kamini Kaushal in emotional blog Veteran Hindi film actror Kamini Kaushal died at the age of 98. Amitabh Bachchan mourned her death, recalling their deep pre-partition family ties.

Mahesh Babu fan travels from Perth to Hyderabad for GlobeTrotter event A dedicated Mahesh Babu fan travelled over 6,000 kilometres from Australia to Hyderabad to attend the GlobeTrotter event.  He documented his journey and even won SS Rajamouli's son Karthikeya's attention.

Lilly Singh is the next global star heading to India after Ed Sheeran, Travis Scott After a high-profile lineup of artists like Enrique Iglesias, Travis Scott, and Ed Sheeran visited India, the momentum is sustained. The next major figure arriving is Lilly Singh, known for her work as an award-winning actress, writer, and advocate.

Rajinikanth's Thalaivar 173: Kamal Haasan shares update on project. Read here After Sundar C exited the highly anticipated 'Thalaivar 173' due to unforeseen and unavoidable circumstances, producer Kamal Haasan assured that he remains dedicated to finding the right script. He said that the project with Rajinikanth will continue as planned.

Exclusive: The Running Man's Edgar Wright says he enjoyed RRR and loves Ray films In an exclusive interview, 'The Running Man' director Edgar Wright shared his fondness for Indian cinema. He also spoke about his desire to visit the country.

Malice review: A glossy, twisty thriller that's high on style, low on surpriseRelease Date:Sat Nov 15, 2025 Malice is a stylish but predictable revenge thriller where a charming outsider slowly dismantles a wealthy family from within. Despite strong performances and luxe settings, the series never quite delivers the tension or depth it promises.

Mahesh Babu remembers father Krishna ahead of GlobeTrotter event Actor Mahesh Babu expresses heartfelt memories of his father Krishna as he launches SSMB 29 Globetrotter with filmmaker SS Rajamouli and co-stars at a major event in Hyderabad.

Super Junior-D&E Exclusive: K-Pop Duo on Their Chemistry and Two-Decade Friendship K-pop duo Super Junior-D&E, composed of members Donghae and Eunhyuk, spoke to India Today's Bhavna Agarwal about their first visit to India. The sub-unit of the group Super Junior, which was part of the initial Hallyu wave, expressed their excitement, stating, 'We always wanted to meet our Indian fans'.

We mistake burnout for commitment: Deepika's strong stand for 8-hour work shifts Actor Deepika Padukone has brought attention to working conditions in the film industry by advocating for an eight-hour shift and calling for increased support for new mothers, following reports of her exit from major projects.

Dining With The Kapoors trailer: A feast of food, family secrets and Kapoor madness Netflix unveiled the trailer of the upcoming documentary special 'Dining With The Kapoors'. It offers an inside look at the Kapoor family as they gather to celebrate Raj Kapoor's 100th birthday.

#PriyankaChopraIsBack: 'GlobeTrotter' look as Mandakini goes viral in 24 hours Priyanka Chopra's first-look poster as Mandakini from SS Rajamouli's upcoming film starring Mahesh Babu has gone viral, ahead of the film's grand 'GlobeTrotter' event in Hyderabad on November 15

SAG Awards renamed to The Actor Awards by SAG-AFTRA after 30 years The longstanding Screen Actors Guild Awards have now adopted a new title aligning with its signature statuette and union merger, reflecting its evolving identity while maintaining core values and traditions.

general news.headline: Go ask Tejashwi, Rameez: Rohini Acharya's first reaction after quitting politicsOn Saturday, Rohini Acharya dropped a bombshell by announcing that she was quitting politics and disowning her family. This came a day after the RJD-led Mahagathbandhan suffered a drubbing in Bihar elections.

Exclusive: India Today accesses 43 CCTV grabs tracing Delhi bomber's carIndia Today accessed 43 CCTV images tracing bomber Dr Umar Nabi's I-20 from Faridabad to Delhi, helping investigators map his movements before the Red Fort blast.

Trump to sue BBC for $5 billion over edited speech despite broadcaster's apologyUS President Donald Trump is set to sue the BBC for up to $5 billion over a wrongly edited video that he claims caused significant reputational and financial damage. The broadcaster's apology has been deemed insufficient by Trump, escalating tensions between the two parties.

Who are BJP's dozen who lost despite party's 88% strike rate in Bihar?Sometimes a few votes make all the difference. The BJP, which won 89 seats out of the 101 it contested in Bihar Assembly polls, lost three seats by slender margins of 30, 178, and 221 votes. Who are the BJP's dozen who lost despite the party's impressive strike rate of 88%?

How a Jharkhand by-poll served JMM a sweet revenge on a bad dayJharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) has secured a decisive Ghatsila by-poll win as Somesh Chandra Soren defeated BJP's Babu Lal Soren by over 38,000 votes, reinforcing JMM's hold. The contest, triggered by the death of former MLA Ramdas Soren, highlighted a battle of political legacies and shifting loyalties, serving as revenge against Ex-CM Champai Soren, who had defected to the BJP last year.

I don't attend parties: Actor Nora Fatehi hits out over drug syndicate link chargeThe Mumbai Police's Anti Narcotics Cell busted a major syndicate run by wanted drug lord Salim Dola, who is said to be an associate of Dawood Ibrahim. Names of several Bollywood personalities emerged in the matter.

Congress questions Bihar voter surge, poll body says 3 lakh people added after SIRThe Congress expressed concerns over a sudden rise in Bihar's voter count ahead of elections, prompting clarifications from the Election Commission. The EC explained the increase was due to late registrations ensuring all eligible voters could participate.

Who is Rameez? Rohini Acharya's post triggers buzz after shock exit from politicsIn a shocking move, Rohini Acharya, daughter of Lalu Yadav, decided to quit politics and disown her family following Mahagathbandhan's rout in Bihar. In her post, she blamed Tejashwi Yadav and his two aides, including one Rameez, for forcing her to take this decision.

Video: Red Fort metro station shakes after blast, sparks panic among commutersA CCTV footage from inside a Delhi Metro station shows the camera suddenly shaking at the exact moment the Red Fort car blast occurred.

Rajamouli-Mahesh Babu's Varanasi: MM Keeravani reveals release window. Read hereMM Keeravani's speech at the event included a key update on 'Varanasi'. The ace music composer revealed the highly anticipated film's release window.

Green card boost for Indians as EB-1, EB-2 dates advance in December visa bulletinThe US December 2025 Visa Bulletin brings encouraging progress for Indian employment-based green card applicants, while family-based categories remain largely unchanged. This update offers renewed hope for skilled Indian workers awaiting their green cards.

IPL 2026 auction on December 16 in Abu Dhabi after 173 players retained: BCCIThe IPL 2026 Player Auction is set to take place on 16th December at the Etihad Arena in Abu Dhabi, announced BCCI on Saturday, November 15. The player retention window for the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2026 season closed on 15 November 2025, with all 10 franchises finalising their squads ahead of the upcoming auction.

Pics: Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra, Prithviraj and team light up GlobeTrotter eventSS Rajamouli's 'GlobeTrotter' aka 'SSMB 29' was launched amid massive fanfare at Hyderabad's Ramoji Rao Film City on November 15. Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra, Prithiviraj Sukumaran, SS Rajamouli and the entire team were in attendance.

177 people, 1 address: 26,000 families in Chennai colony risk losing voting rightsNearly 26,000 families in Chennai's Perumbakkam colony face losing their voting rights due to incomplete address details on voter IDs. The Election Commission struggles to verify voters amid chaotic overlaps in official records.

Shubman Gill stretchered to hospital with neck injury, may miss rest of 1st TestIND vs SA: India captain Shubman Gill is likely to miss the remainder of the first Test against South Africa at Eden Gardens due to a neck injury sustained while playing a sweep off Simon Harmer.

Tejashwi's RJD got more vote share than BJP, JDU but still lost. Here's whyBihar election results: The RJD, which won 25 of the 143 seats it contested, secured 23% of the vote share - the highest by a single party in the elections. It is more than the BJP and JD(U).

New Tata Sierra unveiled ahead of November 25 launch: Reborn with modern stylingTata Motors has unveiled the production-ready 2025 Sierra, reviving the iconic SUV with a modern design, premium tech and new powertrains ahead of its official launch on November 25.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Love affair, blackmail, murder: Mystery over Noida woman's headless body solvedNoida murder: A week ago, a woman's dismembered body was found in a drain near a posh locality in Uttar Pradesh's Noida. Her hands and head were also severed. Now, police have finally solved the case after going through 5,000 CCTV footages.

Kolkata Test in 2x mode: 16 wickets fall on Day 2 in Eden Gardens dustbowlIndia vs South Africa, 1st Test, Day 2: Spin ruled the roost on the second day of the opening Test as India clawed their way back into the contest after being dismissed for a modest 189. Ravindra Jadeja left the visitors tottering at 93 for seven at stumps on an Eden Gardens surface that offered uneven bounce and sharp turn.

What does she want? South rom-coms finally let women have agencySouth Indian romantic comedies are redefining storytelling by focusing on women's perspectives. This shift challenges traditional tropes and finds strong audience support, signalling a cultural change.

BJP cracks down on Bihar rebels, expels ex-Union Minister, two othersThe Bharatiya Janata Party has taken strict disciplinary action by expelling former Union Minister RK Singh for six years due to anti-party activities. This move also includes suspensions of other Bihar leaders amid efforts to curb internal dissent.

How Yadavs caused Tejashwi, RJD-Cong defeatRJD leader Tejashwi Yadav wanted to paint a picture where the tiger and the deer drink side by side. It was that of the Ram Rajya where Bihar would be at peace with itself. But the overzealous, unwarranted and violent roars of the Yadav cadre revived old fears. The noise turned the imagery of the tranquil pond into a reminder of Jungle Raj. Tejashwi's promises, it seemed, were devoid of the promise of harmony.

6 crore voters at risk: Vijay questions SIR in Tamil Nadu ahead of 2026 pollsThalapathy Vijay has raised alarm over the SIR electoral roll revision in Tamil Nadu, warning that 6.38 crore people could risk losing voting rights due to an opaque verification process.

Exclusive: Lee Pace on Edgar Wright and the duality of The Running ManLee Pace praised director Edgar Wright for crafting the "unbothered" and masked McCone, a hunter in the dystopian film The Running Man. Pace highlighted the film's dual narrative, where his character is the network's protagonist despite doing "grotesque" violence.

Ustad Amjad Ali Khan mastered sarod, but couldn't finish schooling. Here's whySarod maestro Ustad Amjad Ali Khan featured on this week's UnPolitics podcast and shared interesting stories from his childhood, youth and the journey from a music enthusiast to a musical legend. His journey and mastery of the string instrument will live on through ages in India's musical folklore.

sports.headline: IPL 2026 auction on December 16 in Abu Dhabi after 173 players retained: BCCI The IPL 2026 Player Auction is set to take place on 16th December at the Etihad Arena in Abu Dhabi, announced BCCI on Saturday, November 15. The player retention window for the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2026 season closed on 15 November 2025, with all 10 franchises finalising their squads ahead of the upcoming auction.

Shubman Gill's neck injury likely from bad sleep, not workload: Morne Morkel India vs South Africa: Bowling coach Morne Morkel has dismissed suggestions that Shubman Gill's neck injury was caused by workload, insisting it may simply be the result of a stiff night's sleep. The setback, however, is all set to leave India without their captain for the rest of the first Test in Kolkata.

Simon Harmer plays down Kolkata surface criticism: Pitches in 2015 were worse South Africa spinner Simon Harmer compared the current Kolkata Test surface to the 2015 India tour, saying the previous wickets were more challenging. The Eden Gardens pitch has come under the scanner after 16 wickets fell on Day 2 of the first Test.

Chess World Cup: Arjun Erigaisi reaches quarters, Harikrishna to play tiebreak GM Arjun Erigaisi rejected a draw and defeated Levon Aronian to advance in the FIDE World Cup 2025 in Goa on Saturday. Harikrishna must now face a tiebreak to stay in the competition.

RCB face backlash for retaining Yash Dayal amid rape allegations Royal Challengers Bengaluru's decision to retain Yash Dayal for IPL 2026 has sparked backlash on social media, as the bowler is facing two criminal cases involving allegations of sexual assault — one under the POCSO Act involving a minor and another alleging sexual exploitation under the pretext of marriage.

My father's never satisfied with me, even if I score 200: Vaibhav Suryavanshi Vaibhav Suryavanshi revealed that his father, Sanjiv Suryavanshi, is never happy with his performance, even if he scores 200. The 15-year-old recently registered the second-fastest T20 century by an Indian in the Rising Stars Asia Cup.

Shubman Gill stretchered to hospital with neck injury, may miss rest of 1st Test IND vs SA: India captain Shubman Gill is likely to miss the remainder of the first Test against South Africa at Eden Gardens due to a neck injury sustained while playing a sweep off Simon Harmer.

Ricky Ponting's blunt take on why PBKS released Glenn Maxwell Punjab Kings (PBKS) released Glenn Maxwell ahead of IPL 2026 after the Australian all-rounder struggled in 2025, scoring just 48 runs in six innings, with head coach Ricky Ponting saying he wouldn't fit into the team's starting XI.

KL Rahul released? DC head coach mocks trade rumours after IPL retentions Delhi Capitals coach Hemang Badani mocked all trade rumours surrounding KL Rahul ahead of IPL 2026. Ahead of the players' retention deadline, there were speculations that KL Rahul might be traded.

CSK confirm Ruturaj Gaikwad remains captain after Sanju Samson trade IPL 2026 retentions: Chennai Super Kings confirmed on the retention deadline day that Ruturaj Gaikwad will continue to captain the side. Speculation was rife that Sanju Samson, who was traded from Rajasthan Royals, would take over the baton.

IPL 2026: How teams stack up for mini auction after retention deadline day IPL 2026 retentions full list: Chennai Super Kings and Kolkata Knight Riders released a big chunk of their squad, making room for the mini auction. While KKR let go of Andre Russell, CSK released their Sri Lankan pacer Matheesha Pathirana. Here's the full list of players retained and relased by teams on deadline day.

Shubman Gill stretchered to hospital with neck injury, may miss rest of 1st Test IND vs SA: India captain Shubman Gill is likely to miss the remainder of the first Test against South Africa at Eden Gardens due to a neck injury sustained while playing a sweep off Simon Harmer.

Ricky Ponting's blunt take on why PBKS released Glenn Maxwell Punjab Kings (PBKS) released Glenn Maxwell ahead of IPL 2026 after the Australian all-rounder struggled in 2025, scoring just 48 runs in six innings, with head coach Ricky Ponting saying he wouldn't fit into the team's starting XI.

KL Rahul released? DC head coach mocks trade rumours after IPL retentions Delhi Capitals coach Hemang Badani mocked all trade rumours surrounding KL Rahul ahead of IPL 2026. Ahead of the players' retention deadline, there were speculations that KL Rahul might be traded.

CSK confirm Ruturaj Gaikwad remains captain after Sanju Samson trade IPL 2026 retentions: Chennai Super Kings confirmed on the retention deadline day that Ruturaj Gaikwad will continue to captain the side. Speculation was rife that Sanju Samson, who was traded from Rajasthan Royals, would take over the baton.

IPL 2026: How teams stack up for mini auction after retention deadline day IPL 2026 retentions full list: Chennai Super Kings and Kolkata Knight Riders released a big chunk of their squad, making room for the mini auction. While KKR let go of Andre Russell, CSK released their Sri Lankan pacer Matheesha Pathirana. Here's the full list of players retained and relased by teams on deadline day.

KKR release Andre Russell in shocking move, break their old promiseIPL 2026 Retentions: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) have released their charismatic all-rounder Andre Russell, who has been with the team since the 2014 season and contributed to their IPL title wins in 2014 and 2024.

Kolkata Test in 2x mode: 16 wickets fall on Day 2 in Eden Gardens dustbowlIndia vs South Africa, 1st Test, Day 2: Spin ruled the roost on the second day of the opening Test as India clawed their way back into the contest after being dismissed for a modest 189. Ravindra Jadeja left the visitors tottering at 93 for seven at stumps on an Eden Gardens surface that offered uneven bounce and sharp turn.

Eden Gardens deserves to be banned: Fans slam pitch in Kolkata TestIndia vs South Africa, 1st Test: The Eden Gardens pitch was scrutinised for being heavily in favour of spinnners and bowlers. As many as 26 wickets fell on the first two days of the match in Kolkata.

New India citizen Ryan Williams named in AFC qualifier squad vs BangladeshNew India citizen Ryan Williams has been added to the Indian squad for their final AFC Asia Cup qualifier against Bangladesh, which will take place on November 18. Williams recently got his India passport.

England's Mark Wood cleared of hamstring injury, fit for first TestEngland fast bowler Mark Wood has been cleared to play in the opening Ashes Test after scans showed no damage to his left hamstring. The 34-year-old experienced some stiffness during training in Perth earlier this week.

IPL retention highlights: KKR release Russell and Iyer, Punjab let go of MaxwellIPL 2026 retention highlights: Major moves have rocked the cricketing fraternity as Andre Russell and Venkatesh Iyer have been released from KKR while Matheesha Pathirana has been released from Chennai Super Kings.

Samson-Jadeja swap between CSK and RR benefits all parties involved: Anil KumbleAnil Kumble feels that the Sanju Samson and Ravindra Jadeja swap deal between CSK and RR will benefit all parties involved. Samson was exchanged for Jadeja and Sam Curran by RR on IPL retentions deadline day.

Ravindra Jadeja achieves rare Test double; joins Kapil, Botham in elite listRavindra Jadeja joined Kapil Dev in an elite list on Saturday, becoming only the fourth cricketer in history to complete the illustrious double of 4,000 runs and 300 wickets in Test cricket.

England's Mark Wood cleared of hamstring injury, fit for first TestEngland fast bowler Mark Wood has been cleared to play in the opening Ashes Test after scans showed no damage to his left hamstring. The 34-year-old experienced some stiffness during training in Perth earlier this week.

IPL retention highlights: KKR release Russell and Iyer, Punjab let go of MaxwellIPL 2026 retention highlights: Major moves have rocked the cricketing fraternity as Andre Russell and Venkatesh Iyer have been released from KKR while Matheesha Pathirana has been released from Chennai Super Kings.

Samson-Jadeja swap between CSK and RR benefits all parties involved: Anil KumbleAnil Kumble feels that the Sanju Samson and Ravindra Jadeja swap deal between CSK and RR will benefit all parties involved. Samson was exchanged for Jadeja and Sam Curran by RR on IPL retentions deadline day.

Ravindra Jadeja achieves rare Test double; joins Kapil, Botham in elite listRavindra Jadeja joined Kapil Dev in an elite list on Saturday, becoming only the fourth cricketer in history to complete the illustrious double of 4,000 runs and 300 wickets in Test cricket.

Shubman Gill has neck spasm: BCCI after Indian skipper retires hurt in KolkataThe BCCI has issued an update on Shubman Gill after the Indian captain retired hurt on Day 2 of the Kolkata Test on Saturday, 15 November. Gill struck a boundary before leaving the field moments later, returning to the pavilion after appearing to be in discomfort.

Ravindra Jadeja on rejoining RR from CSK: Coming back feels specialStar all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja said coming back to Rajasthan Royals feels special after joining the franchise from Chennai Super Kings ahead of the 2026 edition of the Indian Premier League (IPL).

Croatia secure World Cup 2026 spot, Germany and Netherlands edge closerCroatia secured automatic qualification for the World Cup after a 3–1 comeback win against the Faroe Islands, while Germany and the Netherlands moved closer to booking their places following tense qualifiers.

Rishabh Pant breaks Virender Sehwag's record with most Test sixes for IndiaRishabh Pant broke Virender Sehwag's record for the most Test sixes by an Indian, moving to 92 with a blistering knock on Day 2 at Eden Gardens. His fearless 27 off 24 balls lifted him to seventh on the all-time global six-hitters list.

Fans will be upset over Ravindra Jadeja exit, but CSK felt need for change: CEOCSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan explained why they decided to trade Ravindra Jadeja and Sam Curran to get the services of Sanju Samson from RR. Jadeja left Chennai after being one of their most decorated players and spending 12 seasons.

Big blow for India as Shubman Gill retires hurt with injury scare in KolkataIndia were handed an early concern on Day 2 of the Kolkata Test after captain Shubman Gill walked off the field with a neck strain, cutting short his innings only moments after arriving at the crease.

IPL 2026: Arjun Tendulkar and Shami move to LSG, Nitish Rana heads to DCLSG have completed a double move to secure the services of Arjun Tendulkar and Mohammed Shami from MI and SRH respectively. DC got the services of Nitish Rana from RR as they sent Donovan Ferreira in the other direction.

Sanju Samson joins CSK, Ravindra Jadeja back in Rajasthan after a decadeCSK's decision to overhaul its core has triggered one of the most significant trades in recent IPL history, with Sanju Samson moving to Chennai for Rs 18 crore and Ravindra Jadeja returning to Rajasthan Royals for Rs 14 crore.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.
